entry.title: Phages overcome bacterial immunity via diverse anti-defence proteins
entry.content:
Phages overcome bacterial immunity via diverse anti-defence proteins

  • Erez Yirmiya
  • Azita Leavitt
  • Rotem Sorek
Article22 Nov 2023

entry.title: Structural basis of Gabija anti-phage defence and viral immune evasion
entry.content:
Structural basis of Gabija anti-phage defence and viral immune evasion

  • Sadie P. Antine
  • Alex G. Johnson
  • Philip J. Kranzusch
Article22 Nov 2023

entry.title: HIV-1 Env trimers asymmetrically engage CD4 receptors in membranes
entry.content:
HIV-1 Env trimers asymmetrically engage CD4 receptors in membranes

HIV-1 Env trimers bound to one, two and three CD4 molecules are observed at membrane–membrane interfaces between HIV-1 and CD4-decorated virus-like particles.

  • Wenwei Li
  • Zhuan Qin
  • Walther Mothes
ArticleOpen Access22 Nov 2023

entry.title: Sequential appetite suppression by oral and visceral feedback to the brainstem
entry.content:
Sequential appetite suppression by oral and visceral feedback to the brainstem

Genetically distinct neural circuits in the caudal brainstem receive feedback from the mouth and gut to regulate feeding behaviour on short and long timescales.

  • Truong Ly
  • Jun Y. Oh
  • Zachary A. Knight
ArticleOpen Access22 Nov 2023

entry.title: Structural insights into intron catalysis and dynamics during splicing
entry.content:
Structural insights into intron catalysis and dynamics during splicing

Analysis of the group II intron ribonucleoprotein shows the molecular interactions involved in branchpoint adenosine recognition, lariat formation and exon ligation, providing clues to the evolutionary conservation of structural components and catalytic mechanisms in premessenger RNA splicing.

  • Ling Xu
  • Tianshuo Liu
  • Anna Marie Pyle
ArticleOpen Access22 Nov 2023

entry.title: Repeated Omicron exposures override ancestral SARS-CoV-2 immune imprinting
entry.content:
Repeated Omicron exposures override ancestral SARS-CoV-2 immune imprinting

Exposure to early variants of SARS-CoV-2 results in immune imprinting in mouse models and in humans, reducing neutralizing antibody titres against Omicron variants, which could be mitigated with multiple updated boosters.

  • Ayijiang Yisimayi
  • Weiliang Song
  • Yunlong Cao
ArticleOpen Access22 Nov 2023

entry.title: Trans-vaccenic acid reprograms CD8+ T cells and anti-tumour immunity
entry.content:
Trans-vaccenic acid reprograms CD8+ T cells and anti-tumour immunity

A screen of nutrient-derived compounds identified trans-vaccenic acid as a promoter of effector T cell function, and functional assays demonstrate that this occurs via inactivation of GPR43 on T cells.

  • Hao Fan
  • Siyuan Xia
  • Jing Chen
ArticleOpen Access22 Nov 2023

entry.title: Porin-independent accumulation in Pseudomonas enables antibiotic discovery
entry.content:
Porin-independent accumulation in Pseudomonas enables antibiotic discovery

We use a whole-cell accumulation assay to assess the ability of non-antibiotic, structurally diverse small molecules to accumulate in Pseudomonas aeruginosa, with potential application in developing drugs to target this pathogen.

  • Emily J. Geddes
  • Morgan K. Gugger
  • Paul J. Hergenrother
Article22 Nov 2023

entry.title: Imaging quantum oscillations and millitesla pseudomagnetic fields in graphene
entry.content:
Imaging quantum oscillations and millitesla pseudomagnetic fields in graphene

Imaging of quantum oscillations in Bernal-stacked trilayer graphene with dual gates enables high-precision reconstruction of the highly tunable bands and reveals naturally occurring pseudomagnetic fields as low as 1 mT corresponding to graphene twisting by 1 millidegree.

  • Haibiao Zhou
  • Nadav Auerbach
  • Eli Zeldov
ArticleOpen Access22 Nov 2023

entry.title: Structural insights into cytokine cleavage by inflammatory caspase-4
entry.content:
Structural insights into cytokine cleavage by inflammatory caspase-4

The human lipopolysaccharide receptor caspase-4 captures its cytokine substrate pro-IL-18 via a mechanism that is distinct from known caspase–substrate interactions, leading to inflammasome-independent IL-18 release from macrophages.

  • Pascal Devant
  • Ying Dong
  • Jonathan C. Kagan
Article22 Nov 2023

entry.title: Recognition and maturation of IL-18 by caspase-4 noncanonical inflammasome
entry.content:
Recognition and maturation of IL-18 by caspase-4 noncanonical inflammasome

Activated human caspase-4 directly and efficiently processes IL-18 in vitro and during bacterial infections, cleaving the same tetrapeptide site in pro-IL-18 as caspase-1.

  • Xuyan Shi
  • Qichao Sun
  • Feng Shao
Article22 Nov 2023

entry.title: Epithelial IFNγ signalling and compartmentalized antigen presentation orchestrate gut immunity
entry.content:
Epithelial IFNγ signalling and compartmentalized antigen presentation orchestrate gut immunity

IFNγ signalling in epithelial cells promotes antigen presentation that confers intra-epithelial T cells the ability to limit extracellular ATP and consequent NLRP3 inflammasome activation, controlling pathogenic transformation of CD4+ T cells that promotes colitis and colorectal cancer in mouse models.

  • Ankit Malik
  • Deepika Sharma
  • Bana Jabri
Article22 Nov 2023

entry.title: Intermediate conformations of CD4-bound HIV-1 Env heterotrimers
entry.content:
Intermediate conformations of CD4-bound HIV-1 Env heterotrimers

Single-particle cryo-electron microscopy structures of HIV-1 envelope (Env) trimers bound to one or two CD4 receptors identify intermediate Env conformations that precede host–virus fusion and inform the design of therapeutics to prevent HIV-1 infection.

  • Kim-Marie A. Dam
  • Chengcheng Fan
  • Pamela J. Bjorkman
ArticleOpen Access22 Nov 2023

entry.title: Hopfion rings in a cubic chiral magnet
entry.content:
Hopfion rings in a cubic chiral magnet

Transmission electron microscopy is used to observe three-dimensional topological solitons known as hopfions that in a chiral magnet are found to form rings around skyrmion strings, and a nucleation protocol for these rings is provided.

  • Fengshan Zheng
  • Nikolai S. Kiselev
  • Rafal E. Dunin-Borkowski
ArticleOpen Access22 Nov 2023

entry.title: Autoimmune amelogenesis imperfecta in patients with APS-1 and coeliac disease
entry.content:
Autoimmune amelogenesis imperfecta in patients with APS-1 and coeliac disease

A large fraction of patients with APS-1 and coeliac disease develop enamel dystrophy, characterized by the presence of autoantibodies against the enamel matrix, which are generated through the breakdown of either central (APS-1) or peripheral (coeliac) tolerance to a battery of ameloblast-sepecific proteins.

  • Yael Gruper
  • Anette S. B. Wolff
  • Jakub Abramson
Article22 Nov 2023

entry.title: Genetic continuity and change among the Indigenous peoples of California
entry.content:
Genetic continuity and change among the Indigenous peoples of California

Genome-wide analyses of ancient DNA from individuals from California and Mexico shed light on the spread of Mexican ancestry to California and how it correlates with linguistic flow.

  • Nathan Nakatsuka
  • Brian Holguin
  • David Reich
Article22 Nov 2023

entry.title: Aligning climate scenarios to emissions inventories shifts global benchmarks
entry.content:
Aligning climate scenarios to emissions inventories shifts global benchmarks

Aligning the IPCC-assessed mitigation pathways with the national greenhouse gas inventories shows that key global mitigation benchmarks become harder to achieve, requiring achieving earlier net-zero and lower cumulative emissions.

  • Matthew J. Gidden
  • Thomas Gasser
  • Keywan Riahi
ArticleOpen Access22 Nov 2023

entry.title: Methane throughout the atmosphere of the warm exoplanet WASP-80b
entry.content:
Methane throughout the atmosphere of the warm exoplanet WASP-80b

Transmission and emission spectra of the 825 K warm Jupiter WASP-80b taken with the NIRCam instrument of the JWST show strong evidence of CH4 at greater than 6σ significance

  • Taylor J. Bell
  • Luis Welbanks
  • John A. Stansberry
Article22 Nov 2023

entry.title: SO2, silicate clouds, but no CH4 detected in a warm Neptune
entry.content:
SO2, silicate clouds, but no CH4 detected in a warm Neptune

  • Achrène Dyrek
  • Michiel Min
  • Gillian Wright
Article15 Nov 2023

entry.title: Computational prediction of complex cationic rearrangement outcomes
entry.content:
Computational prediction of complex cationic rearrangement outcomes

  • Tomasz Klucznik
  • Leonidas-Dimitrios Syntrivanis
  • Bartosz A. Grzybowski
